title: 5. Oil Pan
description:
10x 7mm
            
            
              
            
            Don't forget the oil drain plug.
            
              1x 13mm

title: 7. Oil Filter
description: You need to buy the Oil Filter at the PSK Shop.Screw in with your bare HandsScroll your Mousewheel upYou can buy this at PSK Market

title: 10. Rocker
description:
Install 8 Rockers
            
              Tighten with Screwdriver, Mousewheel up 2 times
            
            
              
            
            
              It has to look like this. The metal clips must be above the
              rubber.
            
            
              
            
          
          The installation can be tricky.Sometimes the "Tick" wont
          appear. If thats the Case, just drop the Rocker where it's supposed to
          be installed, then picking it up again and holding it in place. Then
          the tick should actually appear.

title: 15. Water Pump Pulley and Fan
description:
Put the Water Pump Pulley on the Water Pump but 
            DON'T TIGHTEN THE SCREWS
            
              
            
            You need to install the Fan
            
              
            
            Now tighten the screws on the Fan
            
              4x 8mm

title: 17. Camshaft Sprocket
description:
1x 14mm
            
              
            
            Adjust the Sprocket.
            
              Turn so Long until the Arrow Points on the Bolt between the
              Camshaft Sprocket and the Thermostat Housing

title: 19. Crankshaft Pulley
description:
1x 13mm
            
            
              
            
            Adjust the Pulley
            
              Turn so long until the Little Notch fits the sharp triangle

title: 23. Sparkplugs
description:
You need to buy the Sparkplugs at the PSK Shop.Install
          4 Sparkplugs in the Cylinder Head andtighten the Plugs with the
          Sparkplug Socket.You can buy this at PSK Market

title: 26. Flywheel or Flexplate
description:
Flywheel for Manual TransmissionFlexplate for automatic
            Transmission6x 12mm

title: 27. Clutch Assembly
description:
Clutch Disk in Clutch Cover Plate
            
              
            
            
              Clutch Disk and Clutch Cover Plate in
              Clutch Pressure Plate
            
            
              
            
            Install on your Flywheel or Flexplate
            
              6x 8mm
            
            
              
            
          
          You can buy the Clutch Disk at Fleetari

title: 29. Fan Belt
description: You can buy this at PSK Market

title: 30. Adjusting Alternator
description:
Adjust the Alternator with your bare Hands against the Fan
              Belt.
            
            
              
            
            Here the Fan Belt is all loosey goosey.
            
              
            
            And here the Fan Belt is all tighty mighty.
            
              
            
            
              1 Screw tight it with the Screwdriver

title: 31. Distributor
description: 1 Screw tight it with the Screwdriver

title: 35. Attach the engine to the engine hoist
description:
That's one of the most difficult things in the whole game.I've
          found a little trick that works for me.The table in the garage
          is too high to fit the entire engine on it.The problem is the
          oil pan. This means that the engine is always at an angle.It is
          best to place the toolbox/Spanner Set on the floor and then place the
          flat side of the oil pan on top of it. This should ensure that the
          engine is relatively level.Now both screws can be tightened.2x 10mmEt voil√†!

title: ---- Front Suspension ----
description:
For the Front Suspension you will need these Parts:
          
            Steering Rack 26
            Steering Shaft
            Steering Column
            2x Front Lower Control Arm
            2x Front Upper Control Arm
            2x Spring Coils (identical, your choice)
            Front Right Brake Assembly
            Front Left Brake Assembly
            Front Right Link
            Front Left Link
            2x Front Shock Absorber
            2x Tires - You can buy tires at Fleetari

title: ---- Rear Suspension ----
description:
For the Rear Suspension you will need these Parts:
          
            2x Rear Lower Control Arm
            2x Rear Upper Control Arm
            Rear Axle
            2x Spring Coils (identical, your choice)
            2x Rear Shock Absorber
            2x Tires - You can buy tires at Fleetari

title: ---- Installing Engine and Gearbox ----
description:
For your Engine and Gearbox installation, you need:
          
            Your assembled engine
            1x Gearbox
            1x Gearbox Crossmember
            1x Driveshaft

title: 3. Detach the Engine from the Engine hoist
---- Auxiliary Parts ----
description:
No idea what to call this section.Things are a bit chaotic here.
          I've installed everything related around the car.You don't have
          to follow the order. But I'll give you a good insight.For this chaotic chapter, I installed the following:
          
            Exhaust Pipe Front
            Exhaust Pipe Rear
            Exhaust Muffler
            Fuel Tank
            Radiator
            Radiator Hose Bottom
            Radiator Hose Top
            Ignition Coil
            Break Master Cylinder
            Break Lines
            Hand Break Lever
            Gear Lever
            Pedal Box
            Clutch Cable
            Heater Box
            Heater Hose Inlet
            Heater Hose Outlet
            Wiper Motor Assembly
            Battery - You can buy this at PSK Market

title: 10.1 Break Lines on Front Break Assembly
description:
After installing the brake lines and tightening all the screws, you
          must also tighten the screws on the front brake assembly. Otherwise,
          your front brake will not work.1x 10mm

title: 12. Gear Lever
description:
No Screws or Bolts. But you have to tighten it with your bare hands.
          Just like the Oil Filter.Look at the Gear Lever and when the
          Hand Icon appear, scroll your Mousewheel up a few times.

title: 13. Pedal Box
description:
4x 8mmThere are two different Pedal Boxes.Manual and
          Automatic.In my case, i installed the manual pedal box.

title: 19. Place the Battery
description: You can buy this at PSK Market

title: ---- Interior Parts ----
description:
For the Interior you will need these Parts:
          
            Rear Seat Bench
            Rear Seat Backrest
            Parcel Shelf
            Passenger Seat
            Driver Seat
            Ventilation Box
            Fresh Air Duct
            Dashboard
            Instrument Panel
            Dashboard Top Cover
            Dashboard Bottom Cover
            Column Shroud Left
            Column Shroud Right
            Center Console
            Steering Wheel

title: ---- Body Parts ----
description:
For the Body you will need these Parts:
          
            
              2x Light Bulbs - You can buy this at PSK Market
            
            2x Light Head Assembly
            Fender Right
            Fender Left
            Front Bumper
            Grille
            Hood
            Door Right
            Door Left
            Bootlid
            2x Rear Lights
            Rear Bumper

title: 1. Light Bulbs
description: Put in the Head Light AssemblyYou can buy this at PSK Market

title: 6. Hood
description:
4x 7mm
          
            
              
            
            
              So this is a bit tricky. If you having trouble with the hood not
              staying open, it's because you now have to use a hood rod on the
              Corris Rivett.
            
            
              First, open the hood with the left mouse button.
              Hold down the left mouse button.
            
            
              
            
            
              With the left mouse button held down, look near the car battery
              (see photo).
            
            
              
            
            
              As soon as the icon turns into a hand, press the right mouse
              button and the hood rod will extend.
            
            
              
            
            Now you can bolt down the hood with 4x 7mm
            
              
            
            
              
            
            
              If you want to close the hood, simply right-click on the hood
              rod.

title: ---- Fluids ----
description:
To fill up all the Fluids you'll need:
          
            
              Break and Clutch Fluid - You can buy this at PSK Market
            
            Coolant - You can buy this at PSK Market
            Motor Oil - You can buy this at PSK Market
            Gasoline - You can buy this at PSK Market

title: 1. Break and Clutch Fluid
description: Remove the Lid on your Break Master Cylinder and fill it up.Don't forget to close the Lid on your Break Master Cylinder

title: 2. Coolant
description: Remove the Lid on your Radiator and fill it up.Don't forget to close the Lid on your Radiator.

title: 3. Motor Oil
description: Open the Lid on your Cylinder Head and fill it up.Don't forget to close the Lid on your Cylinder Head.

title: 4. Gasoline
description: Open your Tank Lid and fill it up.Don't forget to close your Tank Lid.

title: 6. Front Light Connection - Head Light Left
7. Front Light Connector - Head Light Right
12. Rear Harness Connector - Rear Light Left
13. Rear Harness Connector - Rear Light Right
19. Turn Signal Switch - Dash Harness Connector
